chart_income_hist_description: Density of income divided by credit decision.
chart_select_to_display: Select a chart to display it.
stats_select_column_hint: Select a column to see statistics.
stats_diff_header: Comparison: Normal Data vs Prognosis Data
stats_diff_explain_zero: Distribution of values is similar in both datasets
stats_diff_explain_mean_plus: Values in the prognosis dataset are on average higher than in the normal dataset
stats_diff_explain_mean_minus: Values in the prognosis dataset are on average lower than in the normal dataset
stats_diff_explain_std_plus: Data in the prognosis dataset is more dispersed (greater variability)
stats_diff_explain_std_minus: Data in the prognosis dataset is more concentrated (lower variability)
stats_diff_explain_skew_plus: Prognosis dataset has a longer right tail (larger extreme values on the high end)
stats_diff_explain_skew_minus: Prognosis dataset has a longer left tail (larger extreme values on the low end)
stats_diff_explain_kurt_positive: Prognosis dataset has MORE extreme values (greater number of observations in the tails)
stats_diff_explain_kurt_negative: Prognosis dataset has FEWER extreme values (fewer observations in the tails)
stats_diff_explain_kurt_zero: The distribution of extreme values is similar in both datasets
stats_diff_explain_q1: The 25th percentile (lower quartile): shows the difference for the smallest values
stats_diff_explain_q2: The median (50th percentile): shows the difference for the middle observation - key for interpretation
stats_diff_explain_q3: The 75th percentile (upper quartile): shows the difference for the largest values
stats_diff_explain_quartiles_example: Example: if the Q2 difference for income is +5000, it means the median income in the prognosis dataset is 5000 higher than in the normal dataset
stats_diff_explain_col_income_pos: Prognosis dataset shows higher income values
stats_diff_explain_col_income_neg: Prognosis dataset shows lower income values
stats_diff_explain_col_loan_pos: Prognosis dataset shows higher loan amounts
stats_diff_explain_col_loan_neg: Prognosis dataset shows lower loan amounts
stats_diff_explain_col_credit_pos: Prognosis dataset shows higher credit ratings (better creditworthiness)
stats_diff_explain_col_credit_neg: Prognosis dataset shows lower credit ratings (poorer creditworthiness)
stats_diff_explain_col_years_pos: Prognosis dataset shows longer employment tenure
stats_diff_explain_col_years_neg: Prognosis dataset shows shorter employment tenure
stats_diff_explain_col_points_pos: Prognosis dataset shows higher point values
stats_diff_explain_col_points_neg: Prognosis dataset shows lower point values
prognosis_param_mu: μ (mean) - central value of distribution, around which new data is generated
prognosis_param_sigma: σ (standard deviation) - data spread, determines how much values differ from mean
prognosis_param_samples_info: Samples - example values generated from this distribution for new records
chart_compare_overlay: Compare normal data with prognosis on charts
